body_html: @drpngx @keveman For the record, Caffe and other frameworks use the default (i.e. fast) IDCT. With compressed JPEGs, the slow IDCT is very unlikely to give any accuracy gains, and slows down processing dramatically, especially when the CPU is the bottleneck for another component in the system that has much higher throughput, e.g. a GPU.

With compressed JPEGs, the slow IDCT is very unlikely to give any accuracy gains, and slows down processing dramatically, especially when the CPU is the bottleneck for another component in the system that has much higher throughput, e.g. a GPU.
